items.title: NRLW wrap: Brisbane Broncos thrash the Cowboys 50-4, Gold Coast grab last finals spot
items.summary: It's a big day for Queensland sides in the NRLW, as the Broncos — led by skipper Tamika Upton — are far too good for the third-placed Cowboys, while the Titans clinch the last finals spot with a win over Canberra.

items.title: Supreme Court gives Queensland hospital permission to terminate 12yo girl's pregnancy
items.summary: A 12-year-old girl in residential care in Queensland should be allowed to have an abortion, a court rules, after a judge found she was not capable of making the decision herself.

items.title: Penrith Panthers, Cronulla Sharks win NRL elimination finals against Warriors, Sydney Roosters
items.summary: The Sharks are looking to correct the mistakes of the past, as they advance to the semifinals with a 20-10 victory over the Roosters.

items.title: Advocates call for action on brain health as AIHW reveals dementia is leading cause of death
items.summary: Advocates warn the number of people with the condition could exceed 1 million without government intervention.

items.title: Erika Kirk makes first public statement after assassination of husband Charlie Kirk
items.summary: Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, delivers her first public remarks since the fatal shooting of her influencer husband.

items.title: Wallabies fall to 28-26 defeat against Argentina in The Rugby Championship in Sydney
items.summary: The Wallabies have fallen just short of a magical comeback against Argentina, losing 28-26 in a thrilling Rugby Championship Test in Sydney.

items.title: Bush band tells Aboriginal people's side of the Maralinga nuclear weapon tests story
items.summary: For Liam Tunkin, making music is about continuing his late father's legacy and sharing a dark part of Australia's history.

items.title: A journey through 35 years of Canberra's history since the Raiders last won a minor premiership
items.summary: Two weeks ago, the Canberra Raiders won the NRL's 2025 minor premiership by beating the Wests Tigers. It is their first minor premiership since 1990, and a lot has changed since then.

items.title: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital cancels children in war discussion citing staff safety
items.summary: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital says a symposium on the effect of war on children has been cancelled due to safety fears, but some doctors say pressure from a group opposing antisemitism is to blame.

items.title: Rare good news for critically endangered east coast grey nurse sharks
items.summary: Scientists say increasing numbers of east coast grey nurse sharks is rare good conservation news for the critically endangered species.

items.title: Suns coach Damien Hardwick praised ahead of historic finals clash against Lions
items.summary: Brisbane Lions great Alastair Lynch hails the impact of Damien Hardwick at the Gold Coast Suns as they look to continue their run in the finals.

items.title: Recyclers aim to stop 30,000 tonnes of mining tyres being buried every year
items.summary: Australia's mining industry has been burying enormous, worn out tyres for decades. But a new facility is offering a solution.

items.title: Nourishing and easy sweet potato and lentil bowls - ABC News
items.summary: This jazzy little bowl is made from simple ingredients. The sweet potato is roasted gently with spices and tinned lentils are roasted until crisp.

items.title: Astronomer Grote Reber's ashes are held in radio telescope locations around the world
items.summary: Grote Reber helped spark decades of interest in radio astronomy in Tasmania when he decided to call the southern state home.

items.title: Who is Tyler Robinson, the accused killer of Charlie Kirk?
items.summary: After his father encouraged Tyler Robinson to turn himself in, people close to the 22-year-old provided investigators with crucial insights.

items.title: Wallaroos primed for Rugby World Cup quarterfinal against Canada
items.summary: Considered underdogs against the world number two, the Wallaroos are urged to be bold in their sudden-death encounter in Bristol.

items.title: Adrianne Lenker on Big Thief's evolution and the making of Double Infinity
items.summary: At the peak of their success, Big Thief faced a major emotional rupture that reshaped the group from the inside out. Now, they've returned with their sixth album, shaped by deep creative trust and a renewed commitment to collaboration.

items.title: Yorke Peninsula businesses worry tourists won't return if algal bloom continues over summer
items.summary: After a cold winter, a warm spring is often a welcome time for towns that rely heavily on tourism. But for regional South Australian coastal communities hit hard by the ongoing algal bloom, there's a feeling of concern about what should be a busy period.

items.title: Keio Yoshida tells queer stories differently in their new book, Pride and Prejudices
items.summary: In their latest book, author and human rights lawyer Keio Yoshida draws on their personal experience and legal expertise to demonstrate the importance of sharing queer stories.

items.title: A Sydney council's $378k battle against Woolwich marina expansion
items.summary: Locals have argued if the expansion in Woolwich were to go ahead it "would be like putting a bus station in the middle of a children's playground".

items.title: More than a dozen women complain about Brisbane doctor accused of performing 'sexually motivated' checks
items.summary: Dr Stan Theodoros is facing disciplinary proceedings, lodged by Queensland's health ombudsman, in the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal (QCAT).

items.title: When does Gout Gout run in the 200m at the 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, and other key events
items.summary: The 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo sees Australia's largest-ever team tackle the best athletes on the planet. Here are the key events you won't want to miss.

items.title: Female farmers determined to defy NSW dairy industry exodus
items.summary: As repeated natural disasters and stagnating milk prices see dairy farmers walk away from the industry, these women are looking at smaller changes to help shore up their future.

items.title: Nepal's gen Z protesters are continuing the fight for their future even after picking a new prime minister
items.summary: A calm has fallen on Nepal's streets after days of violence and chaos. But leaders of the gen Z protest movement say the work's not done.

items.title: Journey Home, David Gulpilil shows the film icon's remote homeland 'for the first time'
items.summary: Legendary Yolŋu actor David Gulpilil held an ambition throughout his career to share a part of himself and his culture that the world had never seen before. A new documentary does exactly that.

items.title: Elderly Porepunkah woman left without in-home care as Freeman manhunt continues
items.summary: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

items.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
items.summary: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

items.title: North West Shelf extension comes at critical juncture in Australia's climate conversation
items.summary: Seven years after it was first mooted, the extension of Australia's biggest gas project could not have landed at a more critical juncture for the nation's climate credentials.

items.title: NATO announces operation 'Eastern Sentry' in response to Russian drone incursion in Poland
items.summary: NATO announces plans to beef up the defence of Europe's eastern flank two days after Poland shot down Russian drones that had violated its airspace.

items.title: Former minister Greg Hunt works for Brethren company whose owners made millions on COVID contracts
items.summary: The Sydney-based church has been described by former members and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese as a "cult".

items.title: Donald Trump and his 'good man' Anthony Albanese share some common ground
items.summary: The MAGA president's grip on the Republican party is near total while Albanese holds a sway over his left-leaning caucus like few of his Labor predecessors.

items.title: Netanyahu and Putin escalate their wars as Trump looks on
items.summary: In the Middle East and in Europe, political leaders are making their own arrangements in the absence of US leadership.

items.title: Sushila Karki sworn in as Nepal's new prime minister after gen Z protests prompt political change
items.summary: Sushila Karki garnered widespread support from many young Nepalese people who took to the streets in anger over government corruption.

items.title: South Korean workers return home after ICE raids at US Hyundai factory
items.summary: The workers arrived home to emotional scenes as many consider never returning to the US following the raids which have caused serious tension between the longstanding allies.

items.title: Tyler Robinson, 22, in custody after manhunt for conservative activist Charlie Kirk's killer
items.summary: US authorities arrest a man who they say confessed or "implied" to a family friend that he killed right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

items.title: Pacific leaders reaffirm support for Taiwan's right to attend regional forum
items.summary: Despite pressure from Beijing, Pacific leaders have backed Taiwan's right to attend the Pacific Islands Forum.

items.title: Matildas to face England Lionesses in October international window
items.summary: The Matildas have announced an international friendly against England this October, the first time they will face the European champions since the semifinal of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup.

items.title: Gold miners drive ASX higher as bullion price hits new record
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia dies of cancer aged 30
items.summary: The family of Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia has paid tribute to the former Opals and WNBL player, describing her as a "shining light" after her death from cancer at the age of 30.

items.title: NRL finals: Melbourne Storm defeat Canterbury Bulldogs 26-18, Stephen Crichton injured
items.summary: Bulldogs coach Cameron Ciraldo feels his side was let down by the refereeing performance in their 26-18 defeat to the Storm in their qualifying final.

items.title: Judge awards man $450k in damages after ex-premier's police officer son falsified evidence
items.summary: A Supreme Court judge has awarded NSW man Luke Moore $450,000 in damages after the disgraced police officer son of former senator Kristina Keneally falsified evidence about alleged death threats.

items.title: British YouTube creator Yung Filly to travel home to UK on bail for sexual assault charges
items.summary: British YouTube content creator Yung Filly, who's facing trial in Perth on sex assault charges, is granted permission to travel home to the UK for the first time since he was arrested.

items.title: Tasmanian government consulting on public homebirth model
items.summary: A proposal by the Tasmanian government to introduce a public homebirth model has been welcomed by those in the sector.

items.title: Mop-top virus found in potatoes bought from retail stores in Tasmania
items.summary: Biosecurity Tasmania is working to trace the origins of the two potatoes, as potato mop-top virus continues to spread through Tasmania.

items.title: Independent accreditation system for fertility sector to be established as all recommendations of IVF review accepted
items.summary: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler has announced he has accepted all recommendations of a rapid review into the IVF sector at a meeting with state and territory health ministers in Perth.

items.title: Islamophobia envoy calls for religious discrimination laws, review of approach to counter-terrorism
items.summary: In a landmark report, newly-appointed Aftab Malik also calls for counter-terrorism laws and approaches to be reviewed, and for national inquiries into Islamophobia and anti-Palestinian racism.

items.title: Australia to face Belgium in Davis Cup in Sydney with Final 8 spot up for grabs
items.summary: Lleyton Hewitt's Australian Davis Cup team is ready for another fierce battle with old foes Belgium as they chase a spot in this year's Final 8 in Italy.

items.title: The simple system I use for composting
items.summary: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

items.title: China announces new nature reserve on contested Scarborough Shoal
items.summary: China says its newly announced reserve is about preserving coral, but the Philippines says it is another step towards Bejing tightening its claim on a contested, strategic area of the South China Sea.

items.title: Murray Watt stamps final approval of Woodside's North West Shelf extension to 2070
items.summary: Australia's biggest gas project, Woodside's North West Shelf, has received final approval to extend operations through until 2070.

items.title: Qatar's prime minister accuses Israel of ignoring Gaza hostages in attack on Hamas in Doha
items.summary: The Qatari prime minister tells the United Nations Security Council that Israel went "beyond any borders" with the strike and says Benjamin Netanyahu is to blame for killing "any hope for those hostages".

items.title: New footage shows suspected gunman fleeing scene of Charlie Kirk shooting
items.summary: Authorities say a new video shows the suspect jumping off the roof of a Utah Valley University building before fleeing into a nearby wooded area.

items.title: Netball Australia, players strike revenue-sharing deal in collective player agreement
items.summary: Netball Australia and the players' association strike a landmark revenue-sharing deal as part of a three-year collective player agreement.

items.title: What happens to your data when you trade or recycle your device?
items.summary: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

items.title: After Charlie Kirk's assassination, a bitter blame game pushes the US towards the precipice
items.summary: In a country with more guns than people, an increasingly violent and threatening public discourse is creating serious dangers.

items.title: Albany residents call for lower speed limits after van strikes pedestrian at crossing
items.summary: A crash involving a van and an 81-year-old woman in Albany prompts calls for reduced speed limits from locals and road safety advocates.

items.title: Voter turnout as low as 10 per cent in NT local elections
items.summary: Two out of five of the NT's enrolled voters failed to vote in the jurisdictions recent local government elections, with experts concerned voting fatigue has taken hold.

items.title: How Jamal Fogarty learned to be the hero Canberra needed for its premiership charge
items.summary: Jamal Fogarty has spent a rugby league lifetime waiting to play on a team like the Raiders. Now with the NRL finals approaching, he's ready for his close-up.

items.title: Outback hairdresser a 'hero' to Wilcannia residents longing for a pampering
items.summary: The "salon" is an op shop and the round-trip commute's a doozy, but Juliann Mutch is happy to go the extra distance to pamper her grateful Wilcannia clientele.

items.title: Youth leaders in Nepal discuss interim leadership options with the army as two frontrunners emerge
items.summary: After days of deadly violence, protest organisers have met with Nepal's army to try to plot a path forward for the country, which has a deep distrust of democratic politics.

items.title: Ex-Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years in prison
items.summary: The former Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, has been sentenced to 27 years in prison at the age of 70 and may spend the rest of his life behind bars.

items.title: Tarryn Aiken injures knee as Sydney Roosters win NRLW minor premiership
items.summary: The undefeated Sydney Roosters lock up the minor premiership with another big win despite a slew of injuries, including an apparently serious knee issue for halfback Tarryn Aiken.

items.title: Kiama by-election could signal voter mood across NSW
items.summary: The Kiama by-election this weekend is more than a fight for one seat. It could reveal how voters view the state's major party leaders after scandal and political upheaval.

items.title: Islamophobia has been 'persistent' and 'ignored', envoy says — as it happened
items.summary: A long-awaited report into Islamophobia in Australia has been handed down, with the special envoy finding it has been "persistent" and "ignored".

items.title: Netball final scoring error sparks resignation in Wimmera Football Netball League rivalry
items.summary: A botched score in a western Victorian netball league final has led to a senior official resigning and a police escort at the rival clubs' football match as tensions between the clubs remain.

items.title: Indonesia floods death toll rises as Australian woman thanks her dogs for saving her life
items.summary: Authorities are still cleaning up following the disaster, which hit two islands in the archipelago amid warnings more rain could fall in affected areas in coming days.
